description: I have been periodically trying Gwenview for years. I don't settle on it though as the 'best fit' zoom option has never really worked. It would be so useful to enlarge or reduce images to fill the screen, but no, still one has to zoom + or - repeated times. An obvious shortcoming which lets an otherwise useful tool down.
Awesome app, this one I can not live without.
My favourite viewer, wouldn't wanna be without it.
Great for viewing and makign simple adjustments to photos. Even plays videos!
Gwenview is a fantastic piece of KDE software, and it's got all the basics. A must for Plasma users
Like any GNOME app will never be.

Plugins, they would be amazing, but when I try to install them, they don't work.

In fact, in Kubuntu, I can't even download or find them. Maybe I'm dumb... but as a Linux user for over 20 years I would like to think I can install a plugin.
summary: One star short of a plugin

description: when going to print images on the printer, there is no direct display, when printed in portrait or lenscape, the results are sometimes different.the image view in the window can be a pretty good example

I find "gwenview" one of the best, if not the
best image viewer. It even views moving 
pictures. It is also one of the few viewers
that will print what you see )
I like the basic user interface, but it's impossible to resize a group of photos, which makes it cumbersome.
however why can't I install plugin?
summary: great app to view pictures and videos

description: It always gets the job done and it supports oodles of image formats with no drama!
Definitely, the best navigator for the grand tour of your trove or picture vaults. Allows picture correction.
For the most part it's amazing. Unfortunately the last update made it quite slow...
I was pulling my hair out trying to view 24MP .NEF (RAW) photos on a slow pc. I tried a load of photo viewers and found this one to be outstanding!
I always use this app
Gweniew installed via "Ubuntu Software" cannot open USB or external drives.  Fix this or we'll stop using "Ubuntu Software".

Great KDE software but is not usable when installed as snap package.
- Open option in file menu wont work.
- Uses different mouse cursor.
- Shows two desktop icon entries.
- Auto image index wont work as expected.
The app crash since version 20.04
Whatever I try to open as an image, or just open the app by itelf, crashes it. So i'll just use nomacs then
it's one of a kind
It's the best VIEWER for Linux: simple and fast. Do not confuse with an editor: gwenview has only the barest minimum for editing.
The image thumbnail bar creates a mess of wildly sized windows and it ALWAYS automatically opens.

It's okay - has more ui clutter than I really want in an image viewer, and is unable to open webps. It's possible that this may be resolved by a plugin, but I can't seem to install plugins (even after installing kipi-plugins).
But there's no way assigning mouse scroll wheel for zoom in/out, it's a must!
I recommend it, better than image magic that comes with ubuntu budgie
Damaged a file I opened it in. Luckily I had backups.
Great Software!
When you enter a folder, there is no back button to go to the previous one. This is very annoying.
Crashes frequently. Doesn't save settings. Not exceptable for software that came with clean install of Kubuntu LTS.

Overly not so bad. It does crashes frequently, but what's worse is that it's PLAYING GIFS TWICE AS SLOW!
A 60 second gif will take 120 seconds to complete. Nomacs works better and doesn't crash.
just crashes just crashes just crashes just crashes

Very good for what it is, an image browser with basic image manipulation tools (resize, rotate, etc.). However, it lacks more advanced editing features such as gamma and brightness. I use those frequently, so I prefer gThumb.
crashes a lot. irritating
Just like most other KDE software, it's exactly what you need and full of nice bonuses.
Yet another viewer that doesn't make it possible to batch resize photos, WHY NOT!
Does everything I ever wanted to do with an image viewing software, and does it well.

Default interface buttons are not good. It has numerous insufficiencies and hard to report bug and low or no development of reported issues https://forum.kde.org/viewforum.php?f=213 . I am starting to use XNViewMP instead.

Slow to delete. Sometimes freezes together with taskbar when deleting multiple images.
Ubuntu Studio 22.04 amd Ryzen9000 with 32gb of ram
Not all that stable. Crashes are not uncommon. Some files display with improper gamma making them look very washed out and bright.

It's fast and great for culling RAW image files.                                              
It works great on a laptop when you're travelling
Great for viewing RAW image files from your camera's memory card,
so you can bring home mostly photos that you know you are keepers.
Get rid of the junk photos. Fast and easy. You can also quickly generate 
jpeg files from RAW files, if you need to send a photo to someone in a hurry.

It's pretty good for viewing images. I wish there were more built-in editing tools, like not something super advanced but still, as an example - adding another image on top, or just a drawing tool... It could also use slight UI/UX changes.
its very good

Cannot enter directories on an NFS file system, a USB disk/pendrive or a partition separate from the operating system, so you first have to copy the images to the home directory (or another directory which is visible to the program).

This severely limits its ability.
My go to app for quickly reviewing and sorting through my photos. Great for quickly checking multiple photos of the same thing side by side to pick which is the best picture.

Opens even images that are 2+ gigapixels in size!
takes a while obviously but still great!!
Gwenview is the image viewer i have ever use!

Lightweight image (and video) viewer, almost perfect for file/folder/tag based organisation of photos. My only complaint is that the editing tools don't include a way to correct slightly off-level horizons in photos.
Nice & Simple for cropping etc. ;-)

gwenview creates a tmp folder of the images in work so it can rotate, flip and crop them and also offers to delete them but will not... choosing delete only removes the instance from the tmp folder leafing the original in place. 

this renders gwenview rather useless at weeding thru large groups of files for which ones to delete.... gthumb works as expected despite the GTK UX.
Nice app for basic tasks
Opens many image formats!
Doesn't fit with Debian 11. And it can't browse folder well.
DNG file thumbs display which is great. Olease adapt for mobile screens curre tly its spilling over the right side.
The GwenViewer is good but it bugs when going in-and-out of fullscreen mode in Fedora-38!
summary: Great otherwise but dark mode a problem

description: Für mich (nutze Lubuntu mit dem LXQt-Desktop) ist Gwenview die bessere Alternative zu gThumb.

Gibt gwenview in zwei Varianten:
als snap: kann dann aber nicht auf usb und andere partitonen zugreifen
aus den universal-paketen: Definitiv die bessere Wahl! Diese Version kann überall hingreifen.

Ansonsten ist gwenview klasse!

Dea Programm ist veraltet, da Plasma mittlerweile so verändert wurde, dass Gwenview nur abstürzt. Vielleicht wird jemand, der Vollblutprogrammierer ist, dieses Programm wieder lauffähig machen.
Ristretto ist viel anspruchsloser und schneller.
Very good and well adjustable image viewer with all necessary editing features. Also very well customisable.
Ein sehr guter Bildbetrachter!

I prefer XNViewMP as a real Alternative to IrfanView on Windows. Gwenview has too little functions, like fast image cropping etc.

Using GIMP for that is too extreme, light edits in a viewer are nice.
summary: Nice GUI and good for pretty much only Viewing

description:
...in der Hoffnung endlich die (älteren) .heic Photos von meinem I-Phone händeln zu können hab ich Gwenview unter Ubuntu installiert und wurde entäuscht.

Dass das .heic / .heif Format Müll ist weiß ich selbst, aber leider hab ich nicht damit gerechnet, dass Apple statt mit dem üblichen .jpg-Format einem so einen Mist unterjubelt. Inzwischen hab ich auf .jpg umgestellt, so dass neuere Photos wieder wie gewöhnt im .jpg-Format aufgenommen werden.
Jedoch hab ich eine ganze Reihe von Photos nur als .heic vorliegen... und auch wenn das intzwischen von mir installierte Krita .heic kann ist es doch mühsam einige hundert Bilder blind / ohne Vorschau mit einem Bearbeitungsprogramm zu öffnen.

Friert mir ständig die gesamte GUI unwiederbringlich ein. 

Einziger Weg zur Lösung danach ist sddm über ssh neu starten oder die Kiste hart ausschalten.
Wenn ich auf meinen NAS zugreifen will, beendet sich das Programm.
Einfach gut - zu Empfehlen.
Finde die Funktion - mehrere Bilder gleichzeitig in einem Fenser aufzumachen und ihre Größe anzupassen - richtig gut!

Crashes on SMB Access to NAS on fast swiping.
Stürzt bei großen Bilderordnern SMB-Zugriff auf Nas jedes mal ab - beim Schnellen Durchklicken.
esta bien la app solo que tiene mucho bulto de resultados lo demas okey desarrolladores
MUY BUENACCCCCC

No me permite copiar al portapapeles de forma sencilla o intuitiva. Una función tan básica y tonta como esta no se por qué asumí que vendría por defecto como en el menú contextual al hacer click derecho o en algún botón a la vista que solo diga "Copiar", pero no.
buen visor de imaGENES
Pues me ayuda en algunas tareas como recortar imagen. El único pero que le pongo es que consume muchos recursos.
Promete más de lo que cumple

Creo que en el pasado, cuando yo aún no usaba KDE, sí se podían añadir más complementos, pero ahora o no existen o no los encuentro. Me parecería perfecta si permitiera, o más concretamente no se desactivara la opción de redimensionar cuando se elige más de una imagen. Es una opinión basada en un uso personal, pero lo echo de menos.
summary: Buena, pero echo en falta algún complemento

description:
A diferencia de otros visores de álbumes de fotos, Gwenview no satura la pantalla de letras, "rayas" y elementos molestos. 
Muy buena aplicación a la que tal vez le faltaría alguna herramienta más de corrección y afinar algunas de las ya presentes (se debería poder rotas las imágenes a placer, no de 90 en 90 grados).
Aun así, es de lo mejorcito de KDE. Un aplauso a sus desarrolladores, y ojalá no deje de mantenerse bien, como por desgracia ocurre con otras aplicaciones.
summary: Eficaz, interfaz limpia (aprende, Digikam) y agradable de usa

description: Simplemente excelente, cumple con todo lo que necesito para administrar mi extensa galeria fotografica.
Pero tiene un fallo tremendo, a la hora de imprimir no tienes opciones de fotos multiples,tamaño,colocación etc nada de nada
Tout est à sa place.
summary: Appli très bien faite, rien à dire !

description:
je l'utilise depuis un an pour ranger mes photos de famille.

c'est parfait.
Superbe application pour gérer ses collections d'images/photos.

Fedora 31 Gwenview 19.08.3:

+++: les répertoires avec des photos sont montrés avec des vignettes
----: Les vignettes sont moches, changez l'algo, ya pas d'antialiasing
A quoi ça sert ??????????
Superbe visionneuse très intuitive, qui lit les fichiers raw et peut les recadrer et les redimensionner.
L'outil d'importation des photos foctionne très bien mais il plante systématiquement à la fermeture depuis la dernière mise à jour d'aout 2020.
Parfait pour modifier des images de manière simple
impossible d'imprimer en couleur meme apres avoir bien paramêtré le logiciel et l'imprimante sur color

C'est parfait pour réduire/redimensionner ses images ou photos.
Vous pouvez de manière simple réduire la taille d'une photo soit par pixel soit par poucentage, très pratique !
summary: Parfait pour réduire/redimensionner ses images ou photos. Génial !

description: Application très utile mais qui plante dès que je tente d'ouvrir mes photos jpeg qui ont été converti de brut à jpeg dans le logiciel darktable
Je n'ai pas trouvépour importer des photos.

Super logiciel, mais je n'ai pas trouvé comment renommer 
par lot les images, même après installation du module
externe kipi
Rien a aojouter
summary: Simple, efficace et essentiel pour les classements

description: Lorsque je veux faire défiler les images d'un répertoire, il y a un temps de latence avec écran noir, puis il me réaffiche la vue actuelle. Je dois recliquer "suivante" pour qu'elle apparaisse ! Pas fluide du tout. Pour faire défiler les images instantanément, il n'y a pas mieux que Image Viewer (simple et rapide)
Снял галку "Панель инструментов" и она исчезла. Теперь невозможно её вернуть назад. (((
По сравнению с KDE4 пропала важная особенность - запоминание целевой папки в команах по нажатию F7 и F8. Кроме того не устанавливаются модули (Kubuntu 17.10).
обрезать фото быстро и удобно
Отличная прога! Работает как надо
но не для открытия по умолчанию, слишком уж медленная
Облегчает работу с картинками
Если использовать как вьюер по умолчанию, то может вообще не открываться.
Snap builds are very limited, not webp/jp2 support at all, only jpg
Всегда пользуюсь этой программой для быстрого просмотра изображений, лёгкого редактирования и конвертации. Рекомендую!
вообще перестала работать, при открытии изображения , приложение не открывается вернее отрывается но остается фон предыдыщей папки, а картинки нет
Отличная программа!
VeryGood!
